intro: Thibaudia obliqua, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often zigzagging stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters. Thibaudia obliqua is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
